医学新闻来自News -Medical.net-世界各地的最新医学新闻和研究https://www.news-medical.net/ en-gb
吃超级加工的食物会损害您的肠道 - 在这里炎症需要超级加工的食物破坏了肠道微生物组平衡，导致炎症，微生物多样性降低并增加肠道渗透性。这种微生物组失衡会导致包括糖尿病，IBD，癌症和神经系统疾病在内的慢性疾病。 https://www.news-medical.net/news/20250306/eating-ultra-processed-foods-harms-harms-your-gute28094 heree28099s-how-inflammation-how-inflammation-takes-takes-hold.aspx https://www.news-medical.net/news/20250306/eating-ultra-processed-foods-harms-harms-your-gute28094 heree28099s-how-inflammation-how-inflammation-takes-takes-takes-hold.aspx#comment https://www.news-medical.net/post.aspx?id=66ff709-4DD0-45F6-8F4F4F4F-FFD896661EA52 Thu, 06 Mar 2025 16:59:00 -0500 Eating ultra-processed foods harms your gut—here’s how inflammation takes hold
糖尿病改变了乳腺癌的生物学，研究表明超过1.2亿美国人患有糖尿病或糖尿病前。三阴性乳腺癌（TNBC）是乳腺癌最具侵略性的形式，肥胖驱动糖尿病的TNBC患者通常会有较差的预后。 https://www.news-medical.net/news/20250306/diabetes-changes-the-biology-ology-ology-ogy-of--breast-cancer-study-shows.aspx https://www.news-medical.net/news/20250306/diabetes-changes-changes-the-biology-oology-of--breast-cancer-cancer-study-shows.aspx#comment https://www.news-medical.net/post.aspx?id=99fdec06-1b15-4e79-bf6d-a29423b346a1 Thu, 06 Mar 2025 12:35:29 -0500 Diabetes changes the biology of breast cancer, study shows
研究人员发现为什么硬皮病比男性对女性更大由特殊外科医院研究人员（HSS）领导的两项新研究发现了驱动全身性硬化症（SSC）或硬皮病的关键生物学机制 - 一种罕见且通常是毁灭性的自身免疫性疾病，会引起纤维化（组织硬化）和炎症。 https://www.news-medical.net/news/20250306/researchers-discover-why-scleroderma-aftects-women-more-more-more-than-men.aspx https://www.news-medical.net/news/20250306/researchers-discover-discover-why-scleroderma-aftects-women-more-more-more-than-men.aspx#comment https://www.news-medical.net/post.aspx?id=24cf9807-a3d7-41e5-ab9e-71d11de05a7f Thu, 06 Mar 2025 12:30:38 -0500 Researchers discover why scleroderma affects women more than men
突破性研究定义了免疫疗法和肝移植的理想间隔肝细胞癌（HCC）约占原发性肝癌病例的80％至90％。根据世界卫生组织的数据，在全球范围内，2020年注册了905,700例新病例和830,200例死亡。 https://www.news-medical.net/news/20250306/breakthrough-study-defines-defines-indeal-interval-for-immunotheraphy-and-munotheraphy-and-liver-liver-transplants.aspx https://www.news-medical.net/news/20250306/breakthrough-study-defines-defines-indeal-interval-for-mmunotheraphy-and-munotheraphy-and-liver-liver-transplants.aspx#comment https://www.news-medical.net/post.aspx?id=82057d4e-c5e1-4edf-ad9a-93ac2baaac1fe Thu, 06 Mar 2025 12:30:20 -0500 Breakthrough study defines ideal interval for immunotherapy and liver transplants
研究人员发现大脑失去触摸后重组感觉图的能力西班牙国家研究委员会（CSIC）的联合中心和Elche的MiguelHernández大学（CSIC）的联合中心的一组研究人员（IN）发现，当影响触觉时，发展中的大脑可以重新组织其感官图。 https://www.news-medical.net/news/20250306/researchers-discover-brains-aber-ybrains-ability-to-reorganize-sensory-sensory-sensory-sensory-sensory-maps-fer-fer-fer-loss-loss-touch.aspx https://www.news-medical.net/news/20250306/researchers-discover-brains-aberiabil-to-to-reorganize-sensory-sensory-sensory-sensory-sensory-sensory-fer-fer-fer-loss-loss-loss-touch.aspx#comment https://www.news-medical.net/post.aspx?id=b67346b4-6023-4353-befb-f2d0b94b3cc9 Thu, 06 Mar 2025 12:20:06 -0500 Researchers discover brain's ability to reorganize sensory maps after loss of touch

COPD患者通常会忽略心理健康障碍一项新的研究称，患有慢性阻塞性肺疾病（COPD）患者的心理健康障碍未被诊断和治疗不足，导致症状恶化和生活质量降低。 https://www.news-medical.net/news/20250306/mental-health-disorders-are-ofer-often-over-over-over-over-copd-patients.aspx https://www.news-medical.net/news/20250306/mental-health-disorders-are-are-often-over-overlooked-in-copd-patients.aspx#comment https://www.news-medical.net/post.aspx?id=B280551D-1D88-40A5-95A4-F5BF754BA655 Thu, 06 Mar 2025 11:32:18 -0500 Mental health disorders are often overlooked in COPD patients

研究揭示了静音X染色体如何增强女性脑弹性令人惊讶的是，在小鼠中的工作发现，女性的休眠X染色体可以在生命后期重新捕获，并打开使大脑健康的基因。 https://www.news-medical.net/news/20250306/study-reveals-how-silent-silent-silent-x-chromosome-enhances-enhances-female-female-brain-brain-brain-rasilience.aspx https://www.news-medical.net/news/20250306/study-reveals-how-silent-silent-x-chromosome-enhances-enhances-female-brain-brain-brain-brain-risilience.aspx#comment https://www.news-medical.net/post.aspx?id=12635B91-9039-4DC9-A7CA-A72223C44444096 Thu, 06 Mar 2025 09:53:29 -0500 Study reveals how silent X chromosome enhances female brain resilience
